a.g: When the victory of Allah has come and the conquest,
And you see the people entering into the religion of Allah in multitudes,
Then exalt [Him] with praise of your Lord and ask forgiveness of Him. Indeed, He is ever Accepting of repentance.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Invocations and Supplications
Allah the Exalted said: 'And those who, when they commit an immorality or wrong themselves, remember Allah and seek forgiveness for their sins' {}. And 'Alqamah and Al-Aswad said: 'Abdullah ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with them, said: In the Book of Allah the Exalted are two verses: No servant commits a sin then recites them and seeks forgiveness from Allah the Exalted except that Allah the Exalted forgives him: 'And those who, when they commit an immorality or wrong themselves' {} the verse, and His saying the Exalted: 'And whoever does evil or wrongs himself then seeks forgiveness from Allah will find Allah Forgiving, Merciful' {}. And He the Exalted said: 'So glorify with praise of your Lord and seek His forgiveness. Indeed, He is ever Accepting of repentance' {}. And He the Exalted said: 'And those who seek forgiveness in the pre-dawn hours' {}. And He (the Prophet) ï·º used to frequently say: 'Glory be to You, O Allah, and with Your praise. O Allah, forgive me. Indeed, You are the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful' [108]. And He ï·º said: 'Whoever increases in seeking forgiveness, Allah the Exalted makes for him from every worry an opening and from every difficulty a way out and provides for him from where he does not expect' [109].
